com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.layeredvideo

Class SimpleVideoPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.layeredvideo.SimpleVideoPlayer

  • public class SimpleVideoPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    A video player which includes subtitle support and a customizable UI for playback control.

    NOTE: If you want to get a video player up and running with minimal effort, just instantiate this class and call play();

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Activity activity
      The Activity that contains this video player.
      private LayerManager layerManager
      The underlying LayerManager which is used to assemble the player.
      private PlaybackControlLayer playbackControlLayer
      The customizable view for playback control.
      private SubtitleLayer subtitleLayer
      Displays subtitles at bottom center of video player.
      private VideoSurfaceLayer videoSurfaceLayer
      Renders the video.

    • Field Detail

      • activity

        private final Activity activity
        The Activity that contains this video player.

      • layerManager

        private final LayerManager layerManager
        The underlying LayerManager which is used to assemble the player.

      • playbackControlLayer

        private final PlaybackControlLayer playbackControlLayer
        The customizable view for playback control. It handles pause/play, fullscreen, seeking, title, and action buttons.

      • subtitleLayer

        private final SubtitleLayer subtitleLayer
        Displays subtitles at bottom center of video player.

      • videoSurfaceLayer

        private final VideoSurfaceLayer videoSurfaceLayer
        Renders the video.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleVideoPlayer

        public SimpleVideoPlayer(Activity activity,
                 FrameLayout container,
                 Video video,
                 java.lang.String videoTitle,
                 boolean autoplay)
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity that will contain the video player.
        container - The FrameLayout which will contain the video player.
        video - The video that should be played.
        videoTitle - The title of the video (displayed on the left of the top chrome).
        autoplay - Whether the video should start playing immediately.

      • SimpleVideoPlayer

        public SimpleVideoPlayer(Activity activity,
                 FrameLayout container,
                 Video video,
                 java.lang.String videoTitle,
                 boolean autoplay,
                 PlaybackControlLayer.FullscreenCallback fullscreenCallback)
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity that will contain the video player.
        container - The FrameLayout which will contain the video player.
        video - The video that should be played.
        videoTitle - The title of the video (displayed on the left of the top chrome).
        autoplay - Whether the video should start playing immediately.
        fullscreenCallback - The callback which gets triggered when the player enters or leaves fullscreen mode.

    • Method Detail

      • addActionButton

        public void addActionButton(Drawable icon,
                   java.lang.String contentDescription,
                   View.OnClickListener onClickListener)
        Creates a button to put in the top right of the video player.
        Parameters:
        icon - The image of the action (ex. trash can).
        contentDescription - The text description this action. This is used in case the action buttons do not fit in the video player. If so, an overflow button will appear and, when clicked, it will display a list of the content descriptions for each action.
        onClickListener - The handler for when the action is triggered.

      • addPlaybackListener

        public void addPlaybackListener(ExoplayerWrapper.PlaybackListener listener)
        Set a listener which reacts to state changes, video size changes, and errors.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listens to playback events.

      • disableSeeking

        public void disableSeeking()
        Hides the seek bar thumb and prevents the user from seeking to different time points in the video.

      • enableSeeking

        public void enableSeeking()
        Makes the seek bar thumb visible and allows the user to seek to different time points in the video.

      • getCurrentPosition

        public int getCurrentPosition()
        Returns the current playback position in milliseconds.

      • getDuration

        public int getDuration()
        Returns the duration of the track in milliseconds or ExoPlayer.UNKNOWN_TIME if the duration is unknown.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Fades the playback control layer out and then removes it from the LayerManager's container.

      • hideTopChrome

        public void hideTopChrome()
        Hides the top chrome (which displays the logo, title, and action buttons).

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns whether the player is currently in fullscreen mode.

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean shouldBeFullscreen)
        Make the player enter or leave fullscreen mode.
        Parameters:
        shouldBeFullscreen - If true, the player is put into fullscreen mode. If false, the player leaves fullscreen mode.

      • moveSurfaceToBackground

        public void moveSurfaceToBackground()
        When mutliple surface layers are used (ex. in the case of ad playback), one layer must be overlaid on top of another. This method sends this player's surface layer to the background so that other surface layers can be overlaid on top of it.

      • moveSurfaceToForeground

        public void moveSurfaceToForeground()
        When mutliple surface layers are used (ex. in the case of ad playback), one layer must be overlaid on top of another. This method sends this player's surface layer to the foreground so that it is overlaid on top of all layers which are in the background.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause video playback.

      • play

        public void play()
        Resume video playback.

      • setChromeColor

        public void setChromeColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the top chrome, bottom chrome, and background.
        Parameters:
        color - a color derived from the @{link Color} class (ex. android.graphics.Color#RED).

      • setFullscreenCallback

        public void setFullscreenCallback(PlaybackControlLayer.FullscreenCallback fullscreenCallback)
        Set the callback which will be called when the player enters and leaves fullscreen mode.
        Parameters:
        fullscreenCallback - The callback should hide other views in the activity when the player enters fullscreen mode and show other views when the player leaves fullscreen mode.

      • setLogoImage

        public void setLogoImage(Drawable logo)
        Set the logo with appears in the left of the top chrome.
        Parameters:
        logo - The drawable which will be the logo.

      • setPlaybackControlColor

        public void setPlaybackControlColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the buttons and seek bar.
        Parameters:
        color - a color derived from the @{link Color} class (ex. android.graphics.Color#RED).

      • setSeekbarColor

        public void setSeekbarColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the seekbar.
        Parameters:
        color - a color derived from the @{link Color} class (ex. android.graphics.Color#RED).

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the text views
        Parameters:
        color - a color derived from the @{link Color} class (ex. android.graphics.Color#RED).

      • setVideoTitle

        public void setVideoTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Set the title of the video in the left of the top chrome (to the right of the logo).
        Parameters:
        title - The video title. If it is too long, it will be ellipsized.

      • shouldBePlaying

        public boolean shouldBePlaying()
        Returns whether the player should be playing (based on whether the user has tapped pause or play). This can be used by other classes to look at the playback control layer's play/pause state and force the player to play or pause accordingly.

      • show

        public void show()
        Add the playback control layer back to the container. It will disappear when the user taps the screen.

      • showTopChrome

        public void showTopChrome()
        Shows the top chrome (which displays the logo, title, and action buttons).

      • release

        public void release()
        When you are finished using this SimpleVideoPlayer, make sure to call this method.
